title: Segfault of binary produced with `relocation-model=static` for `x86_64-unknown-linux-musl`

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    println!("main = {:#x}", &main as *const _ as usize);
}
```

I expected to see this happen:
```console
$ rustc -C relocation-model=static --target x86_64-unknown-linux-musl hello.rs
$ ./hello
main = 0x43b008
```

Instead, this happened:
```
$ rustc -C relocation-model=static --target x86_64-unknown-linux-musl hello.rs
$ ./hello
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

This code works, though:
```rust
fn main() {
    println!("main = {:#?}", &main as *const _);
}
```

### Meta
Also happens with current nightly.

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```console
$ rustc --version --verbose

commit-hash: c7087fe00d2ba919df1d813c040a5d47e43b0fe7

host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

LLVM version: 9.0
 
$ rustc +nightly --version --verbose

commit-hash: 6bb3dbfc6c6d8992d08431f320ba296a0c2f7498
```
